The word "Behold" shows that the following questions are very important.

tn.ref: You are trusting in deceitful words that do not help you.
tn.text: "You think that I will save Jerusalem because I will protect my temple. But that is a lie!"

tn.ref: Do you steal, kill, and commit adultery?
tn.text: "You steal, kill, and commit adultery" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Do you swear deceitfully and offer incense to Baal and walk after other gods whom you have not known?
tn.text: "You lie even in your oaths and worship Baal and other new gods." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Then do you come and stand before me in this house where my name is proclaimed and say, "We are saved," so you can do all of these abominations?
tn.text: "Then you come to my house and say 'Yahweh will save us" so that you can continue to sin greatly." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Is this house, which carries my name, a den of bandits in your eyes?
tn.text: "This house is ... a den of bandits in your eyes!" or "You act as though you think my house ... should be a place where bandits can go to hide!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])
"robbers" or "people who steal things from others"

"never stop burning" or "never stop being angry"

tn.ref: Add your burnt offerings to your sacrifices and the meat from them.
tn.text: Although Yahweh required sacrifices, he no longer wanted their sacrifices because the people remained disobedient after coming to the Temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_irony]])
Yahweh continues to remind the people of Judah of the way that the people of Israel rebelled.

tn.ref: by their own stubborn plans of their wicked hearts
tn.text: "according to their own plans because they were wicked and stubborn"

tn.ref: so they went backwards, not forward
tn.text: "and so they turned their backs to me and not their faces." AT: "and so they refused to pay attention to me, instead of eagerly obeying me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

The word "they" refers to all of the people of Israel had lived since their ancestors came out of Egypt.

tn.ref: So proclaim all these words to them, but they will not listen to you. Proclaim these things to them, but they will not answer you.
tn.text: These two sentences say the same thing, The second emphasizes the message of the first. AT: "Tell them my message but the will not listen and change their evil ways." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
